title: California’s online privacy bill for kids would force tech companies to redesign services
itunes:title: California’s online privacy bill for kids would force tech companies to redesign services
itunes:author: Marketplace / Marketplace Tech Staff
description: California’s Legislature passed the Age-Appropriate Design Code Act this week. The bill would add website design and age verification requirements for apps and sites likely to be used by kids under the age of 18. Marketplace’s Kimberly Adams speaks with Jen King, a privacy and data policy fellow at Stanford’s Institute for Human-Centered Artificial Intelligence.
